Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on freedom of speech, which is a fundamental right.
The government lacks the capability to accurately discern truth from misinformation.
The vast amount of information available makes it impossible to judge all statements as true or false.
The legislation could cause more harm than good by potentially censoring truthful information.
The example of COVID-19 origins shows how initial claims of misinformation can later be proven true.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is every Australian's fundamental right.
No government has the wisdom of capability to discern what is true and what is not.
Censoring truthful reporting will itself cause 'harm' by preventing us from learning from our mistakes.
